newsitem.title: USA: Bradley files for $200 mln shelf.
newsitem.headline: Bradley files for $200 mln shelf.

text.p: Bradley Real Estate Inc filed Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration to sell up to $200 million in common and preferred stock.
When combined with a previous registration, Bradley will have a total offering of $234,460,000 in common and preferred stock available for sale.

Net proceeds will be used to repay debt incurred in connection with the acquisition or improvement of shopping centers, to acquire additional shopping centers and to fund expansion of and/or improvements to such shopping centers or to certain shopping centers already owned by the company.
Bradley, based in Northbrook, Ill., is a fully-integrated real estate operating company and an owner and operator of community and neighborhood shopping centers in the midwest.
